title: Suspect arrested at BIA for defrauding Rs.1.8 bln through pyramid scheme
byline: A 52-year old Sri Lankan arriving from Malaysia has been arrested by the CID at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for defrauding around Rs. 1,800 million from several persons through a pyramid scheme and fleeing the country a year ago.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that showers or thundershowers will occur at times in Northern and North-western Provinces and in Puttalam and Trincomalee districts.

title: Over 3,000 driving licenses temporarily suspended so far this year
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic (DMT) says that the courts have temporarily suspended over 3,000 driving licenses during the time elapsed this year (2024).

title: Indonesia volcano belches colossal ash tower
byline: A volcano in eastern Indonesia erupted more than half a dozen times on Thursday, catapulting a colossal ash tower five miles into the sky against a backdrop of lightning as nearby residents fled in panic.

title: Postal voting for 2024 General Election ends today
byline: The marking of postal votes for the 2024 General Election is scheduled to end today (8).

title: Schools closed on Nov 13 and 14 for General Election
byline: The Ministry of Education (MoE) has announced that all schools across the island will remain closed on November 13 and 14 due to the 2024 General Election.

title: Motorcycle pillion rider killed by lightning strike
byline: The pillion rider of two persons who were travelling on a motorcycle was struck by lightning in Eravur last evening (07).

title: Female school principal in Ragama arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: The female principal of a school in the Ragama area has been arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 150,000 in exchange for admitting a student to the Grade 01 class for 2025, the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) said.

title: Port officials brief minister on serious delays in container clearances
byline: Minister Vijitha Herath made a visit to the Colombo Port on Thursday (7) to look into the existing issues including a delay in container clearances.

title: Female principal remanded over bribery charge
byline: The female principal of a school in Ragama who was arrested for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 150,000 from a parent in exchange for admitting their child to the Grade 01 class, has been remanded until November 22.

title: Two dead and 12 missing after fishing boat sinks off South Korea
byline: Two people have died and 12 are missing after a fishing boat sank on Friday in waters off South Korea’s southern resort island of Jeju, officials said.

title: Rushdie’s ‘Satanic Verses’ can be imported in India as court told 1988 ban order untraceable
byline: India’s three-decade ban on importing author Salman Rushdie’s controversial ‘The Satanic Verses’ book has effectively been lifted after a court said the government was unable to produce the original notification that imposed the ban.

title: Elon Musk’s net worth jumps $26.5 billion after Trump’s election victory
byline: Elon Musk, a billionaire entrepreneur, had his net worth surge by an incredible $26.5 billion when Donald Trump won the U.S. presidential election.

title: Weather advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an advisory for severe lightning in several provinces and districts.

title: Govt aiming to provide concession to purchase stationery books for school children
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that the government intends to provide concessions for school children to purchase stationery books, staring from next year.

title: Election chief’s request to all voters in Sri Lanka
byline: The Chairman of the Election Commission R.M.A.L. Rathnayake requests all the voters in Sri Lanka to exercise their franchise in the upcoming General Election.

title: Education Ministry issues circular on school social media groups
byline: The Ministry of Education has issued a circular for school principals and relevant education authorities to oversee and minimize the adverse effects of school social media groups, introduced following the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Allowance for school children who can’t afford books and equipment – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says an allowance will be provided for school children who are unable to purchase stationary books and equipment.

title: 11 candidates arrested for violating election laws
byline: Sri Lanka Police says it has so far received 340 complaints related to the upcoming parliamentary election.

title: Sri Lanka’s remittance inflow at $587.7 million in October 2024
byline: Sri Lanka has recorded an 11.7% increase in workers’ remittances from January to October 2024 compared to the same period in 2023, according to latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).
